title: Missoula Training Race
description: The Missoula/Clinton Training race is a road race event held on a 7 mile circuit course.
course: The course is a 7.5 mile circuit that is mostly flat with one short rise.
registration: Registration will be held at Missoula Bicycle Works on the morning of the race. Registration opens at 9:00am
directions: The start line and parking area for the Clinton Training race is located about 19 miles east of Missoula in Clinton, MT. The parking area is located to the south of I-90 adjacent to the freeway.

title: Norris Road Race
course: Starts on River Rd by the golf course

address.street: Helena BLM Scratchgravels District, Echo Dr. TH

title: Herron Hammer
description:
Herron Park Mountain Bike XC Race
Herron Park, Kalispell, Montana
course: 6.3 mile loops, mostly ST, climby with super fun descent!  Beautiful setting and great footing.
registration: Register online for $20 or day of for $25.  One-day licenses available for beginner racers only ($10).  If you have held a USAC license in the last 3 years, you need to renew your annual license to race (new USAC rule).  USAC annual licenses available onsite.  Registration starts at 8:00 AM on site.  Registration is in the picnic shelter at the top of the hill.
notes:
Course will be ready to preride late Saturday afternoon and Sunday morning up until 9:30 AM.  Kids race will happen while results are being tabulated after the regular races.
$1500.00 in prize money to the Cat 1/Pro Men and Women racers.  Great merchandise prizes for all other races.
directions: From the south (via Hwy 93):  turn left on Rocky Cliff Rd (about two miles south of Kalispell)...there is a coffee kiosk on the corner and propane tanks on the right.  Turn left again where Rocky Cliff ends (Airport Rd.)  Airport Rd. changes name to Foys Canyon Rd.  Stay on it and it will take you right to Herron Park.  Park in the parking lot.

title: Kettle House Beer League
description: Weekly race series leading up to the Pro XCT on June 21st. 5 weeks of racing every Wednesday night at Marshall Mountain.  For more information: http://www.missoulaxc.org/schedule/kettlehouse-beer-league/
course:
Week 1: Short Track lower section of the Pro XCT course with 2 start times. One for "B" racers 5:30pm and "A" racers 6:15. 
Week 2: Short Track Same as week prior
Week 3: Modified XC - This would be the course that we will use for the Cat 3 Men, Cat 3 Women, and Cat 2/3 Juniors. It's the regular XC course, except that it uses the alternate descent that comes down the center gully (instead of the more challenging ridge descent), and that it cuts off the "Chainbreaker" descent/climb. The A-Line jump would be closed. 5:30 start.
Week 4: XC Course no jump- This is the XC course like we'll see it for the ProXC Course. It would use the descent and climb at "Chainbreaker" as well as the more technical ridge descent to the base area. The A-Line jump would be closed. 5:30 start.
Week 5: ProXCT Course- All open. Chainbreaker, ridge descent, and the A-Line are all open for preview at race speed. 5:30 start.
registration: Registration is online through USA Cycling or can be done day of the race at the venue. Registration closes 15 min prior to the start of the race each Wednesday.
directions: Located at Marshall Mountain 7 miles from downtown Missoula. From the Van Buren I90 exit take East Broadway towards East Missoula. East Broadway is also called Highway 200. Follow East Broadway/Hwy 200 for roughly 3.6 miles. Turn left onto Marshall Canyon Road (There will be a Marshall Resort Sign). Take Marshall Canyon Road for 2.7 miles. Parking is in the lot before the gate or along the road.

title: Pedal the Pintlers
description: The weekend's flagship event provides opportunities for 25 mile, 50 mile, or the most challenging, Century ride, 100 mile rides though arguably the most beautiful landscapes of Southwest Montana. The Turbo Twenty event provides shuttle service to Georgetown Lake from Anaconda’s Washoe Park to enjoy a breathtaking ride back to Anaconda.
course:
The 25 mile route departing from the Washoe Park is a great ride for the novice cyclist. A breathtaking view along with a gradual climb up Spring Hill. A challenging yet rewarding experience awaits.

The 50 mile route, starting at Washoe Park, is a ride to remember as you proceed west past Spring Hill. Experience the grandeur of the Pintler Mountain Range as you ride past Silver Lake and beautiful Georgetown Lake. The ride climbs to the highest point where the breathtaking view of Georgetown Lake to your left meets the view of Montana's Rock Creek Valley on your right. This awe inspiring ride descends around Georgetown Lake and back to Anaconda's Washoe Park.

The 100 mile route has the reputation of being the "toughest century ride around". After riders take in the glorious view to the west of Anaconda and around Georgetown Lake, the cyclists will begin the journey south east. Up and over the Continental Divide past wildflower covered meadows and gorgeous views of the Pintler Mountain Range. Next up, the Big Hole Valley, the highest and widest mountain valley of southwestern Montana with the Big Hole River flowing through the center. The turnaround point offers a rewarding pie stop for riders who would like to take a break and enjoy the scenery before returning to Anaconda.
registration: Pre-registration is available at www.usacycling.org or will be available on-site the day of the event.  Pre-registration will be $55 for the 25, 50 or 100 mile rides or $45 for the Turbo 20.  Day-of registration will be $65 and $55, respectively.
notes: The weekend's flagship event provides opportunities for 25 mile, 50 mile, or the most challenging, Century ride, 100 mile rides though arguably the most beautiful landscapes of Southwest Montana. The Turbo Twenty event provides shuttle service to Georgetown Lake from Anaconda’s Washoe Park to enjoy a breathtaking ride back to Anaconda.
directions: Pedal the Pintlers will start and finish at scenic Washoe Park in Anaconda.  Please visit www.anacondabikefest.org for directions.

title: Missoula XC at Marshall Mountain Presented by Zillastate
Missoula Freeride
description: Missoula Freeride Camp is back for Summer 2014!
course:
Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced free ride mountain bike camps are offered in a week long camp for kids! We look at the fundamentals of riding, jumping and technical trail riding. Camp meets for orientation on Monday at Lowell Elementary school at 9 am on the Southeast side of the park. 
Lowell Elementary 1200 Sherwood St. Missoula, MT 59802
Prices vary for each camp
Beginner--> $225'
Intermediate-->$215
Advanced -->$200
*Include a T-shirt or hat with registration
registration: RJ Wells at Missoulafreeridemt@gmail.com to register

title: The Beartooth Blitz
description: A 23 mile Time Trail up the Beartooth Pass.  he run up Beartooth Pass was recently named one of the 5 top bike climbs in the nation, the Beartooth Pass is a once-in-a-lifetime ride. The day's activities start at Rock Creek Resort, located 6 miles south of Red Lodge. Racers will leave in 30-second intervals in a time trial format. This category 1 climb rises up over 4,700 feet during its span of 23 miles. So you better enjoy the 66 feet of descending grade that you get at the starting line. The race ends at the scenic West Summit of the Beartooth Pass.
course: 23 miles with 5020 feet of climbing with 2 summits over 10,000 feet.  Starting line at Rock Creek Resort and finishes at the west summit of the Beartooth Pass in WY.
registration: Register for this amazing event today at USAcycling.com.  Early registration is $40 (plus one day race license if needed).  Registration goes up to $50 (plus one day race license if needed) on May 16, 2014.  Online Registration ends on June 29, 2014.   Day of registration is available for $60 (plus one day race license if needed).   All racers entered before the June 19 deadline will receive promotional race gear!  Racer's who register the day of race gear will be handed out on first come first serve.
notes:
June 27, 2014

    5 - 8 p.m. - Packet pick-up and registration in Red Lodge

June 28, 2014

    6:30 - 7:30 a.m. - Packet pick-up and registration at Rock Creek Resort, 6 miles south of Red Lodge, Montana
    6:30 - 7:30 a.m. - Racer sign-in and flight assignment for ITT.
    8 a.m. - Pre race meeting
    8:30am - Race start for 23-mile individual time trail.  Start times will be in your race packets at pickup.
    TBA - Race cut-off. This will be determined by the number of racers.
    11 a.m. - Noon - Lunch and awards, at Rock Creek Resort

title: First Annual Road Race to Rapleje
24 Hours of Flathead
description: 24 Hours of Flathead is a non profit 24 Hour Benefit Mountain Bike Race being held at Herron Park in Kalispell, MT.  A race to provide awareness and adaptive equipment to individuals living with paralysis and other life altering disabilities
course: Roughly 10 mile course with a mixture of climbs and descents.
registration:
Categories
1. USACycling National Championship Cats:
a. Solo: Female, Male, 
b. Four person: Open, Junior Female, Junior Male (Please note that all persons on a team must register at the same time)
* there are no qualifiers to enter in these categories, they are open to the general public, and encouraged!

To be eligible to race in the Championship cats above, you must possess a valid USAC 2014 license. They can be purchased at usacycling. org or at packet pickup on Aug 29th at Wheatons in Kalispell..

2. Non-Championship Cats/24 Hours of Flathead
a. Solo: female/male 18-49, female/male 49+
b. Duo: female/male/co-ed (Please note that all persons on a team must register at the same time)
c. Four person: female/male/co-ed (Please note that all persons on a team must register at the same time)
c. Five person: open (Please note that all persons on a team must register at the same time)

Waivers:
Each rider must complete a waiver before receiving a timing chip or race packet. We’ll provide waivers for signing at packet pickup and via email one week prior to the race.  For those under 18, your parent or guardian must sign your waiver. Picking up packets for friends or teammates is permitted, only with a signed waiver for that friend or teammate.

Refunds
We offer registration transfers until June 8. After June 8, no transfers. Transfers cost $10, payable in cash or check at packet pickup. Contact Us to transfer your registration, please include the new rider’s registration information.

Cancellations:
The safety of racers, your crew, and our wonderful volunteers and staff is our number one priority! In the event that a race must be cancelled or shortened due to Mother Nature or other uncontrollable circumstances, refunds will not be issued.
notes:
Waivers:
Each rider must complete a waiver before receiving a timing chip or race packet. If registering online, you will sign the waiver at that time, but if you are registering the day of we will provide waivers for signing at packet pickup. For those under 18, your parent or guardian must sign your waiver. Picking up packets for friends or teammates is permitted, only with a signed waiver for that friend or teammate.

Refunds:
We offer registration transfers until Aug 8. After Aug 8, no transfers. Transfers cost $10, payable in cash or check at packet pickup. Contact us to transfer your registration, please include the new rider’s registration information.

Cancellations:
The safety of racers, your crew, and our wonderful volunteers and staff is our number one priority! In the event that a race must be cancelled or shortened due to Mother Nature or other uncontrollable circumstances, refunds will not be issued.


When registering for a team, please follow these directions:

1. You MUST reguster all entrants at the SAME TIME and PAY ALL TOGETHER first person selects the appropriate category and then on the next page in blue you must select "Register Additional Riders or Racers", but make sure that ALL team memebers have a USA Cycling Account, otherwise you cannot register them.

3. Please create a team name too - this will be used for our timing guy.

**If you are camping on-site, you must purchase a camping pass for a tent or vehicle.
 If one is not purchased at time of registration and you will be camping, you will be required to pay the fee the day of the race**
directions: Herron Park is located in Kalispell, MT.  Just 125 miles north of Missoula, MT, 80 miles south of the Canadian Border, and 35 miles from Glacier National Park.

title: Rolling Thunder
description: Rolling Thunder is a cyclocross race in Missoula, MT.
course: The course is technical, with bumpy sections, off camber sections.  The lap is 4:30 - 7 minutes in length.  The elite women race at sunset and the elite men race under the lights.
registration: You can register online to receive a discount or day of.
notes:
For Montanans this is one of the only options for you to race in your own field with your fellow category members.

"Prizes and cash will not exceed $1999"
directions: From I90 take Reserve St to Spurgin, take a right on Spurgin, and then left on Tower St.  The race venue is at the baseball stadium, please park in the grassy field.

title: Herron X
description: Herron X is back in 2014 and better then ever! Sunday October 12th at Herron Park in Kalispell. Come race one of Montanan's longest standing events - you'll see why!
course: 3.5 Mile course on grass, dirt and gravel.  One run up and one barrier section.
directions: Half a mile north of Foy's Lake in Kalispell
